moduleMetadataJson.name: PhoenixContact PLC Remote START/STOP Command
moduleMetadataJson.description:
PhoenixContact Programmable Logic Controllers are built upon a variant of
        ProConOS. Communicating using a proprietary protocol over ports TCP/1962
        and TCP/41100 or TCP/20547.
        It allows a remote user to read out the PLC Type, Firmware and
         Build number on port TCP/1962.
        And also to read out the CPU State (Running or Stopped) AND start
         or stop the CPU on port TCP/41100 (confirmed ILC 15x and 17x series)
         or on port TCP/20547 (confirmed ILC 39x series)
author: Tijl Deneut <tijl.deneut@howest.be>

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: RHOSTS
options.description: The target host(s), range CIDR identifier, or hosts file with syntax 'file:<path>'

options.name: RPORT
options.description: Set action port, will try autodetect when not set

options.name: SSLVersion
options.description: Specify the version of SSL/TLS to be used (Auto, TLS and SSL23 are auto-negotiate) (Accepted: Auto, TLS, SSL23, SSL3, TLS1, TLS1.1, TLS1.2)

options.name: SSLVerifyMode
options.description: SSL verification method (Accepted: CLIENT_ONCE, FAIL_IF_NO_PEER_CERT, NONE, PEER)

options.name: Proxies
options.description: A proxy chain of format type:host:port[,type:host:port][...]

options.name: ConnectTimeout
options.description: Maximum number of seconds to establish a TCP connection

options.name: TCP::send_delay
options.description: Delays inserted before every send.  (0 = disable)

options.name: ACTION
options.description: PLC CPU action, REV means reverse current CPU state (Accepted: STOP, START, REV, NOOP)
